questions.question: No sooner had the ship touched shore ………………… a soldier of the tenth legion leaped into the water.
questions.description: Sooner is a comparative word. We use ‘than’ after it.

questions.question: The boy went to school ……………… he had finished his meal.
questions.description: We use 'as soon as' to suggest that something happens immediately after another.

questions.question: ……………….. ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise.
questions.description: Where is a place word. It is also a relative adverb that can connect two clauses.

questions.question: There was one philosopher ……………… chose to live in a tub.
questions.description: Only 'who' can be used to refer to people. Whom can refer to people but it acts as the object of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: He must have done his duty …………….. he is a conscientious man.
questions.description: For is a coordinating conjunction. It can mean because.

questions.question: He trudged on ……………….. he was very tired.
questions.description: As and because have similar meanings. We use 'though' to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: Your arguments are weighty ………………. they do not convince me.
We must eat to live, ……………… we should not live to eat.
questions.description: We use 'but' to connect contrasting ideas.

questions.question: They serve God well ……………… serve his children.
questions.description: Who refers to people and act as the subject of the verb in the relative clause.

questions.question: Control your passions ……………. they will control you.
He came oftener ……………… we expected.
questions.description: After comparative expressions we use 'than', not 'when'.

questions.question: My heart leaps up …………….. I behold a rainbow in the sky.
questions.description: When and whenever are possible here. Whenever is more emphatic.
